result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Emmet Doughty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant will have no further contacts w/law enforcement during term of agrmt. that give rise to probable cause for arrest due to criminal conduct.
2)Defendant shall notify Pepin County District Attorney's Office of any change of residence or employment.
3)One month prior to completion of contract, defendant must contact Pepin County District Attorney's Office for a final interview.
4)Report in person as requested by the Pepin County District Attorney or other supervisor designated by him.
5) The defendant must follow the rules and regulations as set forth by probation, if applicable.
ADDITIONAL CONDITIONS:
A.  I agree that upon successful completion of this agreement, 15CM22 will be dismissed and I will plead guilty to a county citation for disorderly conduct.

supervisions.notes: AMENDED 06-06-2016:  Order to eliminate the requirement for DNA sample and surcharge.
Serve 5 days in the Pepin County Jail commencing 06-23-2016 at 7:00 p.m. with huber privileges.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Emmet Doughty

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael Emmet Doughty in court with attorney Lars Helmer Loberg.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached, defendant will plead in 16CF13 as DPA, 16CM19 will be dismissed, 15CM22 DPA be revoked and sentence.  Court advises defendant of charges/max penalties, felony prohibitions if convicted.  Defendant enters plea of no contest to felony charge; agrees to State's oral motion in 15CM22 to revoke DPA.  Court revokes DPA in count 2 of 15CM22 and finds defendant guilty.  Plea Colloquy. Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, defer accepting plea in 16CF13 and approves the DPA.  15CM22 sentenced to 5 days in the PCJ w/credit for 1 day with work release; pay costs; provide a DNA sample; be fingerprinted on the dismissed theft charge in 16CM19; advised of appeal rights.

Defendant Michael Emmet Doughty in court with attorney William A. Schembera.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Schembera informs court of resolution.  Count 1 will be amended to county disorderly conduct; count 2 DAGPA.  Subject to plea negotiations court amends count 1 to county disorderly conduct.  Court reviews DPA.   Court reviews PLQ/WOR form.  Defendant pleads guilty to amended count 1, guilty to count 2.  Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea to count 1 and finds defendant guilty.  Court defers acceptance of defendant's plea in count 2 and approves DPA.  Court imposes a forfeiture of $326.50 on count 1.

Defendant Michael Emmet Doughty in court with attorney William A. Schembera.   Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel requests another date.  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Emmet Doughty in court with attorney William A. Schembera.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received complaint, waives reading.  Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights.  NGP entered and right to speedy trial waived.  Counsel referred to scheduling clerk for status conference date/time.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

Authorization to Appear and Act.
Pursuant to 971.04(2) Wis. Stats. The Defendant in this case, authorizes his attorney, William A. Schembera, to appear and act on my behalf in any manner and with leave of the court.
